name: contouring
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the action of changing the shape of something, making some parts higher and some parts lower, or giving it smooth curves: He supervised the contouring of the land around the pool he had commissioned.
a design which makes something closely follow or fit around a curved surface or shape: The guitar's contouring makes it an exceptionally comfortable instrument to play.
the use of make-up to create darker and lighter areas on your face, giving the effect of changing or emphasizing its shape: I find this product very good for highlighting and contouring.
geography
  specialized the process or fact of putting lines on a map that join points of equal height or depth: They sought his cartographical expertise on future map scales and contouring.
More examplesFewer examplesFor construction of the maps shown, standard contouring has been applied.Tractors and other equipment have been used for contouring and planting. The technique of liposuction can be used for body sculpting or contouring.If you're just starting out with contouring, try our step-by-step makeup tutorial.
